I generally test that it is not null,...and possibly for anything else that might occur in the constructor (like how you passed in a length).  If you are trying to test that you can actually create an ArrayList of your user defined type - as in your example - I would also test that you really can add an object of that type, and that you cannot add an object that is not of that type,...I don't want to test the ArrayList itself, since I trust Sun has done that, but I would want to test that it correctly recognizes what is and isn't my custom type.

-------------- Original message -------------- 
From: Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> 

Hi,
How can we test if a "new" instance of an object of a certain user defined
type is created? e.g.

reqFieldTypes = new ArrayList<FieldType>(fieldTypes.length);

Thanks,
-Kamal.
